ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Pretty good course, you get a lot better at reading papers as the semester goes on.
I would recommend it to all MBB seniors, who are planning to use research in the future. The course teaching you to critically analyze papers.

The people you take this class with will make or break the class. Overall, it's a pretty well laid out class with good instructors, but you'll need to interact with your classmates on a pretty regular basis, and if you care and they don't, it's pretty frustrating.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course has been incredibly helpful in helping me discover a new kind of scientific thinking and a host of useful techniques.
It shows the practical application of science, that builds on all the core classes we have taken thus far for the major.

It did a very good job of showcasing the broad purposes of experiments with the weekly themes, and it does a good job of showing how what we learned in class was discovered or applied. My research is actually more in pharmacology and drug discovery from natural products than in MB&B, so it doesn't help my research very directly at this point, but may be useful as I get farther with this project.
